1.text: Apply leather conditioner if the boots are made from leather.

2.text: Insert the end of a broomstick through the opening in the boot.

3.text: Press downwards on the boot to stretch it.

4.text: Bend the sole as you stretch the boot material to break in the boots even more.

5.text: Repeat 2-3 times to stretch out the boot more if needed.

6.text: Fill 2 plastic quart-sized bags with water and seal them.

7.text: Push the bags down into the boots so they are filling the toes.

8.text: Place the boots in your freezer overnight with the heels propped up.

9.text: Take the boots out of the freezer and thaw them for 20 minutes.

10.text: Remove the bags and repeat the process to stretch the boots more.

11.text: Put on 2 pairs of thick socks and then put on your boots.

12.text: Hover your blow dryer over the tight areas of the boots for 30 seconds.

13.text: Apply a leather conditioner to the boots after you’re finished.

14.text: Apply leather conditioner if the boots are made from leather.

15.text: Turn the widening and lengthening handles counter-clockwise.

16.text: Insert the stretcher into the boots and adjust the length and width.

17.text: Leave the stretcher in place for 24 hours or longer.

18.text: Try on the boots to see if they fit better.
